sentences.english: Officials say the lion appeared to be starving and was 4- to 5-years-old.
sentences.chinese: 官员称这头狮子大约有四五岁，很明显已经饥肠辘辘。

sentences.english: But the lazy fox went about hungry the whole winter.
sentences.chinese: 而懒惰的狐狸这一冬天都要饥肠辘辘地到处乱窜了。

sentences.english: So the stomachs of the hungry must also compete with fuel tanks.
sentences.chinese: 所以，饥肠辘辘的人们又多了油箱这个竞争对手。

sentences.english: Betty Chinn will never forget what it feels like to be hungry and homeless.
sentences.chinese: 关惠群永远不能忘记饥肠辘辘和无家可归的感觉。

sentences.english: I feel very hungry before lunchtime.
sentences.chinese: 傍午，我就感觉饥肠辘辘了。

sentences.english: That night, the hungry guests sat waiting for the soup.
sentences.chinese: 当晚，饥肠辘辘肚子的客人们都坐着等那碗汤了。

sentences.english: The hungry man heaped up the food on his plate.
sentences.chinese: 这位饥肠辘辘的汉子把食物堆集在自己的盘子里。

sentences.english: Sometimes he gets hungry and eats like a glutton.
sentences.chinese: 他有时弄得饥肠辘辘且暴食如饕餮。

definition: to eat one's fill/to be full
sound made by an empty stomach
to feed to the full/to cram
to chew on a large slab (idiom); a large mouthful is hard to chew/to tuck into a great meal
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
lit. to eat without tasting the food/worried or downhearted (idiom)
